name: places/ChIJ2eK2rVdZwokRVMm8N7UbvMs
formattedAddress: 250 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 250 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012-5525, USA

originalText.text: Would not recommend. I had brought in one button down to get cleaned and one shirt to get tailored. The button down got returned to me with a massive dark spot that looked like an oil stain on the elbow, and the shirt I got tailored was completely messed up. When I brought in the shirt, he said he would fix it but would charge me again. He proceeded to say they had done what I asked them to when it was nowhere near what I had asked them to do and I had made sure to be so clear when explaining the first time. I didn't even bother asking them to fix the button down, figured I would just take it all to a new place.

originalText.text: I strongly recommend against using this dry cleaners. They shrunk my pants by over two inches in length, making them too short to possibly wear. When I returned he said he could fix them, but when I came to pick them up, Benji turned the blame on me; asking me who else I had taken the pants to to get them shortened. I told him no one, that they had shrunk after cleaning them, and he basically told me I was making it up. I offered to show him photos of how much they'd shortened and he told me unless I have measurements, I have no proof. He even accused me of taking it to some other dry cleaner who ruined it. He wouldn't provide me the liability cost which is clearly stated on the cleaning tag to be 10x the cost of the service. I would like the owner of this establishment to reach out and provide me compensation for this damage.

originalText.text:
I gave him a dry clean designer  hoodie.
It came smaller with stain and he was so rude and telling me he knows what he does. Like blaming it on me…  it’s expensive and ruining your clothes. NO GO !

originalText.text: They wear masks when you enter now; fast/reliable service. Friendly.
